author: Ben Marquis
title: Sheriff Pledges to Back Trump After Praising Him for Supporting Law Enforcement
text:
Mike Pence Visits with DC Police Officers, Thanks Them for Their Service 
One member of the association with positive words after the meeting with Trump was Pennsylvania’s Chester County Sheriff Carolyn “Bunny” Welsh, who summed up the relationship perfectly: “The president had our back and we assured him, we have his.” 
“They seated me right next to the president. It was wonderful,” Welsh told The Philadelphia Inquirer . “He was very open and very gracious.” Advertisement - story continues below 
Welsh stated that Trump “listened intently” as the “very enthused” sheriffs around the table expressed their top concerns, with Trump in turn ticking off a list of the top priorities for his administration to focus on, such as border security, crime and drugs , terrorism and strengthening the bonds between local, state and federal law enforcement agencies. 
Welsh likely earned the prominent seat next to the president at the meeting by being one of the first elected officials in the Philadelphia area to endorse his candidacy, even meeting with members of his family and serving as a delegate for him at the Republican National Convention. 
“I said, ‘Remember, Pennsylvania is the state that put you over the top,'” Welsh added. “He laughed about that. He patted me on the arm and said, ‘Yes, I remember that. Good job.’” 
During the meeting in the Roosevelt Room, Welsh was the first sheriff to speak after Trump’s opening remarks, according to the official transcript . Advertisement - story continues below
